title: Peace, Human Rights & RA 6713
what: This covers principles of peace and human rights in public service, combined with RA 6713 ethics standards for officials in the Philippines.
tutorial: Learn how public servants support peace and protect human rights while following ethical standards.
steps:
1. Study core human rights and peace concepts.
  2. Understand RA 6713 norms of conduct.
  3. See how they work together in government.

sections.title: Peace Concepts in Public Service
sections.what: Peace concepts mean maintaining public order, reducing conflict, and promoting social harmony.
sections.tutorial: Example: A barangay official mediates during a community dispute to restore peace.
sections.steps:
1. Know what peace means in society.
  2. Identify government roles in promoting peace.
  3. Study real examples of peace-building work.

sections.title: Community Mediation
sections.what: Mediation is resolving disputes by bringing parties together to discuss solutions.
sections.tutorial: Example: Two neighbors have a noise dispute; the barangay council helps them talk and agree.
sections.steps:
1. Find the conflict.
  2. Gather both parties to talk calmly.
  3. Help them make a fair agreement.

sections.title: Conflict Resolution
sections.what: Conflict resolution includes strategies to handle disagreements and prevent violence.
sections.tutorial: Example: Police and community leaders train together to prevent clashes during protests.
sections.steps:
1. Recognize potential conflict areas.
  2. Create strategies to prevent or manage conflict.
  3. Act early to stop escalation.

sections.title: Human Rights in Public Service
sections.what: Human rights are basic rights every person has, like freedom, dignity, and safety.
sections.tutorial: Example: A government clinic ensures no one is denied service based on race or beliefs.
sections.steps:
1. Learn major human rights (e.g., speech, religion, equality).
  2. Know public service duties to protect them.
  3. Ensure policies respect these rights.

sections.title: Non-Discrimination
sections.what: Non-discrimination ensures fair treatment for all, no matter their background.
sections.tutorial: Example: A social worker gives assistance equally to everyone regardless of religion.
sections.steps:
1. Identify groups often excluded.
  2. Act with fairness and respect to all.
  3. Challenge unfair treatment when you see it.

sections.title: Right to Information
sections.what: Right to information ensures people can access government documents easily.
sections.tutorial: Example: Providing clear procedure guides at public offices.
sections.steps:
1. Make essential documents available during office hours.
  2. Explain policies in plain language.
  3. Respond quickly to requests.

sections.title: RA 6713 Ethics Standards
sections.what: RA 6713 sets strong ethical norms to ensure public officials serve with integrity, fairness, and accountability :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
sections.tutorial: Officials must avoid conflicts of interest, follow professionalism, and live simply.
sections.steps:
1. Read the declared policies in the Act.
  2. Learn the 8 core norms of conduct.
  3. Apply them in daily government service.

sections.title: Norms of Conduct
sections.what: The 8 norms guide how officials should act ethically :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.
sections.tutorial: Includes fidelity to public interest, professionalism, justice, neutrality, responsiveness, patriotism, democracy, and simple living.
sections.steps:
1. Memorize each norm.
  2. Reflect on ways to live them.
  3. Create habits that reinforce them.

sections.title: Prohibited Acts and Responsibilities
sections.what: This covers duties like submitting SALNs, avoiding gifts, and duties to serve the public :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.
sections.tutorial: Example: You file SALN every April, don’t accept non-nominal gifts, and respond to public requests within 15 working days.
sections.steps:
1. Gather and honestly declare your assets, debts, and interests.
  2. Refuse gifts that may influence your decisions.
  3. Respond to public letters within 15 working days.

sections.title: Integration of Peace, Human Rights, and Ethics
sections.what: This shows how peace-building and human rights promotion connect with ethical public service.
sections.tutorial: Example: A mayor resolving a land dispute must act fairly (human rights), support community reconciliation (peace), and follow neutrality and justice (RA 6713).
sections.steps:
1. Recognize the roles of peace and rights in your public duty.
  2. Use RA 6713 norms when handling such cases.
  3. Ensure your actions are fair, transparent, and respectful.
